name: Paleo Chicken Stew
ingredientLines: 6 oz skinless, boneless chicken breasts, cubed
instructions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium-high heat. Saute onion and garlic in hot oil until softened, about 5 minutes.
Stir chicken, sweet potatoes, crushed red pepper, paprika, and sea salt with the onion and garlic in the saucepan.
Pour as much chicken broth into the saucepan to make the mixture as soup-like or stew-like as you'd like it.
Bring the broth to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and simmer until the chicken is no longer pink in the middle and the sweet potatoes are tender, about 30 minutes.

name: Paelo Breakfast Muffins
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a muffin pan with paper liners.
Combine bacon, onion, and green bell pepper in a medium mixing bowl.
Divide bacon mixture among the muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.
Crack 1 egg into each cup. Sprinkle chives and a pinch of salt over each egg.
Bake in the preheated oven until eggs are set, about 20 minutes.

name: Paleo Turkey Cashew Chili
instructions: Heat olive oil in a heavy-bottomed saucepan with a lid over medium-high heat. Saute onion in hot oil until fragrant, about 3 minutes.
Stir garlic and sofrito into the onion; saute until the garlic is fragrant, about 3 minutes more.
Push the mixture to the side of the saucepan.
Break turkey into pieces and add to the saucepan in the space free of the onion mixture, cook for 5 to 7 minutes.
Stir tomatoes, water, and about 3/4 of the tomato paste into the turkey mixture until even in color.
Add cashews, chili powder, cumin, and cocoa powder. Stir mixture to incorporate seasoning, place the lid on the saucepan.
Reduce heat to medium-low, and cook at a simmer, stirring frequently and adding water to thin as desired, until the tomatoes are breaking down, about 1 hour.
Season with salt and pepper.

name: Paleo Sweet Potato Casserole
ingredientLines: 1 lb sweet potatoes, peeled and cubed
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Boil the sweet potatoes until tender, about 10 minutes. Drain and return to pot.
Pour in the remaining ingredients for the mash and blend with an immersion blender. Place in a 1.5-quart baking dish.
For the streusel, pulse the bacon and pecans a few times in a food processor. Mix with the coconut sugar and coconut oil, and sprinkle over the sweet potatoes.
Bake for 10 minutes. Serve immediately.

name: Paleo Cauli Couscous
instructions: Process cauliflower in batches by pulsing in a food processor until it has the consistency of rice.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Saute red bell pepper in hot oil until hot, about 2 minutes.
Add shallots and garlic and saute until soft, about 2 minutes
Stir cauliflower with the vegetables in the skillet; cook and stir until the cauliflower is hot, 3 to 5 minutes.
Pour chicken broth over the cauliflower mixture, season with salt and thyme. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for about 5 minutes.
Stir lemon zest and lemon juice into the mixture, continue cooking until the lemon flavor penetrates the cauliflower, about 2 minutes more.
Remove skillet from heat, add olives and parsley, and toss to mix.

name: Paleo Bacon Sweet Potato Stew
instructions: Cook and stir onion in olive oil in a soup pot over medium-high heat for 5 minutes.
Add bacon and continue cooking, stirring frequently, for another 3 minutes.
Add celery and carrots, continue stirring and cooking until vegetables have softened slightly, about 3 minutes.
Add cumin, paprika, turmeric, kosher salt, ground black pepper, saffron threads, and garlic.
Cook and stir until garlic is fragrant and slightly soft, 3 more minutes.
Add sweet potatoes and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low, and cook until sweet potatoes are tender, about 20 minutes.
Stir in lemon juice, adjust salt and ground black pepper to taste. Blend until smooth.

name: Paleo Fish Piccata
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Pat the fish dry, then season with salt and pepper. Add flour to a large shallow bowl. Dredge the fish lightly in the flour, shaking off the excess.
In a large nonstick skillet, heat oil and 1 tbsp ghee over medium high heat. Add fillets and cook until 3 minutes per side. Set aside.
Wipe the skillet clean, then add remaining ghee to the skillet over medium heat. Add the onions and stir for about 1 minute, add the garlic and cook 30 seconds.
Add the broth, mushrooms, capers and lemon juice. Cook for bout 3 minutes to reduce the mixture by half. Return the fish to the skillet and cook for about 30 seconds.
Serve immediately, topped with the sauce.

name: Omelet Muffins With Spinach And Broccoli
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Line a muffin tin with paper liners.
Beat eggs, heavy cream, salt, and pepper in a bowl with an electric mixer.
Fold in kale, broccoli, and onion until evenly mixed.
Pour mixture into the prepared muffin tin, filling each cup 3/4 full.
Bake in the preheated oven until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean, 20 to 25 minutes.

name: Paleo Banana Pancakes
instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together egg yolks, bananas, almond flour, and baking powder.
In a separate large bowl using a hand or standing mixer, whip egg whites until stiff peaks form, 4 to 5 minutes. Gently fold whipped egg whites into batter until evenly combined.
Grease a large nonstick pan with cooking spray and place over medium-low heat. Pour about ¼ cup pancake batter onto the pan, spreading it out evenly.
Cook until both sides are lightly golden, enjoy!

name: Paleo Chili
instructions: Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir beef in the hot skillet until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease.
While meat is browning, melt ghee in a saucepan over medium heat. Add onion, bell pepper, and garlic cook, 3 to 5 minutes.
Dice 2 tomatoes and add to the saucepan with the onion and bell pepper.
Place remaining  tomatoes in a blender and puree, transfer puree to the saucepan with the vegetables.
Stir green chiles, cumin, chili powder, salt, garlic powder, and black pepper into the chili.
Stir browned beef into the saucepan with the chili. Simmer until heated through, about 30 minutes.

name: Paleo Zucchini-Beef Meatballs
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F.
Place green onion, zucchini, basil, and garlic in the bowl of the processor and pulse to break up a bit. Add ground beef, salt, and pepper, and pulse to combine.
Place sliced green onion, grated zucchini, minced basil, and minced garlic on a cutting board. Mince with your knife further, until the veggie mixture is very fine.
Transfer to a large mixing bowl. Add ground beef, salt, and pepper and stir with your hands or a fork until the veggie mixture is well distributed.
Scoop mixture and roll into meatballs. Place in a baking dish and pour sauce over meatballs to coat. Shake the pan a bit to distribute the sauce.
Bake for 20 minutes, then serve.

name: Parmesan Zucchini Crisps
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F. Line a metal baking sheet with parchment paper. Set aside.
Arrange zucchini in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Season with a pinch of salt and pepper. Place 1 tsp grated Parmesan cheese on each slice.
Bake for 15 minutes and serve.

name: Paleo Chicken-Cauliflower Rice Casserole
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Preheat the oven to 325°F.
Trim the inner core of the cauliflower and break into florets. Transfer to a food processor. Pulse the food processor in until broken down into rice-sized grains.
Squeeze the cauliflower rice in a dry, clean dishcloth to remove excess liquid. Transfer the cauliflower rice to a 9" x 13" baking dish sprayed with cooking spray.
Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper. In a skillet heat half of the olive oil over medium-high heat. Add the chicken and cook 5 minutes per side.
Transfer the chicken to a cutting board to cool. When cool enough to handle, shred into bite-sized pieces. Add the chicken to the cauliflower rice in the baking dish.
In the same skillet, heat the remaining olive oil. Add onion and saute for 1 minute. Add the mushrooms and saute until cooked, about 5 minutes.
Add the spinach in batches and cook until wilted. Season with salt and pepper, and remove from heat. Transfer the mixture to the baking dish.
Whisk together the chicken broth, coconut milk, eggs, nutmeg and remaining salt and black pepper. Pour the egg mixture over the chicken and vegetables.
Bake for 30 minutes. Let cool before serving.

name: Old Fashioned Potato Salad
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add potatoes and cook until tender but still firm, about 15 minutes. Drain, cool, peel and chop.
While potatoes cook, place eggs in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil.
Cover, remove from heat, and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from hot water, cool, peel and chop.
Combine the potatoes, eggs, celery, onion, relish, mayonnaise, mustard, garlic salt, celery salt, and pepper in a large bowl.
Mix together well and refrigerate until chilled.

name: Paleo Chicken Parmesan
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place chicken breast cutlets between 2 sheets of heavy plastic on a solid, level surface.
Firmly pound with the smooth side of a meat mallet to 1/4-inch thickness. Season on both sides with salt and pepper.
Mix almond flour, oat flour, parsley,  basil, thyme, and oregano together in a shallow bowl.
Whisk eggs in a shallow bowl. Dip chicken cutlets in whisked eggs to coat both sides. Dredge in almond flour mixture on both sides.
Heat 1/4 cup olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook chicken cutlets in batches until browned, about 3 minutes per side. Drain on paper towels.
Cover a large baking pan with a thin layer of tomato sauce, arrange chicken on top.
Spoon some sauce over each cutlet. Sprinkle Parmesan cheese on top and add tomatoes.
Bake in the preheated oven until chicken is no longer pink in the center, about 20 minutes.

name: Paleo Butternut Squash Porridge
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Place butternut squash halves, cut-side up, in a baking dish, fill dish with 1/4 inch of water.
Bake in the preheated oven until softened, 50 minutes. Cool squash.
Scoop squash flesh into a bowl and mash with a fork or potato masher until smooth. .
Stir coconut milk and cinnamon into squash adn top with blueberries

name: Paleo Omelet Muffins
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 °F. Grease 6 muffin cups or line with paper liners.
Beat eggs together in a large bowl. Mix ham, bell pepper, onion, salt, black pepper, and water into the beaten eggs.
Pour egg mixture evenly into prepared muffin cups. Bake in the preheated oven until muffins are set in the middle, 18 to 20 minutes.

name: Paleo Peanut Butter Cookies
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350°F. Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
Combine peanut butter, stevia, egg, and vanilla extract in a bowl and mix well until a dough is formed.
Roll dough into 12 balls. Place on the prepared baking sheet and press down twice with a fork in a criss-cross pattern.
Bake in the preheated oven until edges are golden, about 12 minutes. Cool for 1 minute before transferring to a wire rack to cool completely.

name: Orange Chicken
ingredientLines: 12 oz skinless, boneless chicken breasts, sliced
instructions: Cook rice in a pot of water according to the instructions on the packaging.
Meanwhile heat vegetable oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir chicken, garlic, and red pepper flakes for 5 to 7 minutes.
Whisk soy sauce, honey, orange juice, and orange zest together in a small bowl; pour over chicken.
Cook and stir until sauce coats chicken, about 1 more minute. Serve over cooked rice. Sprikle with chives.

name: Paleo Chicken Marsala
instructions: Slice chicken breasts in half widthwise using a sharp knife.
Cover with plastic wrap, pound with the flat side of a meat mallet to 1/4-inch thickness. Season both sides with salt and pepper.
Heat 1 tablespoon olive oil and 2 teaspoons butter in a large skillet over medium heat. Add 3 chicken pieces; cook until golden, about 5 minutes per side.
Transfer to a large platter. Cook remaining chicken pieces in batches, adding 1/3 tablespoon olive oil and 2 teaspoons ghee for each batch.
Cook and stir shallot in the hot skillet until shallots soften, about 1 minute. Add mushrooms, cook until browned, about 5 minutes.
Season with salt and pepper. Pour in Marsala wine, cook until slightly reduced.
Pour in chicken stock, simmer until slightly thickened, about 1 minute.
Stir 1 tablespoon ghee into the skillet. Return chicken to the skillet, simmer until heated through, about 1 minute. Garnish with chopped parsley.

name: Paleo Scrambled Eggs
instructions: Beat eggs in a bowl. Stir in coconut milk, salt, and pepper until well combined.
Heat oil in a skillet over medium-low heat, pour in egg mixture. Cook and stir until fluffy and firm, 5 to 7 minutes.

name: Paleo Kick Butternut Squah Soup
ingredientLines: 1 butternut squash, peeled, deseeded and chopped
instructions: Melt coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Cook and stir onion in the hot coconut oil until golden brown, 7 to 10 minutes.
Stir squash, chicken broth, almond milk, cinnamon, cayenne pepper, nutmeg and ginger together in the pot with the onion.
Bring to a boil and cook until the squash is fork-tender, about 30 minutes.
Puree soup with an immersion blender. Add avocado in small batches, pureeing each before adding the next.

name: Paleo Vegan Acai Bowl
instructions: Place mango, pineapple, acai, water, chia seeds, agave nectar and lime juice in a blender; pulse until smooth and creamy.
Pour mixture into 2 bowls and top with banana, kiwi and strawberries.

name: Panzanella Bread Salad
instructions: To make the bread cubes, heat the olive oil in a large saute pan. Add the cubed bread and salt. Cook for 5 minutes.
Mix everything together and let marinate, covered, at room temperature for at least 30 minutes.

name: Paleo Carrot Leek Soup
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: In a large pot over high heat, add olive oil. When the oil is hot, turn the heat down to medium and add onions and leeks. Saute for 5 minutes, stirring regularly.
Add carrots, potatoes, paprika, cashews, turmeric, coriander, sour cream, salt, and pepper. Mix everything well.
Add vegetable broth and bring it to a boil. Cover and cook for about 20 minutes. Using an immersion hand blender puree the veggies.
Taste and add any extra seasonings. Serve immediately.

name: Pan Fried Chinese Dumplings
instructions: Soak dried prawns in a bowl of hot water for 30 minutes. Drain and finely chop.
Soak rice vermicelli in a bowl of warm water for 10 minutes. Drain, squeeze out excess water, and finely chop.
Beat eggs and 1 pinch salt together in a bowl until light and foamy. Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a wok or large skillet over medium heat, add eggs.
Cook until set, about 2 minutes. Flip the omelet and cook 1 minute more. Cool omelet on a work surface, cut into small pieces.
Combine egg, prawns, vermicelli, chives, mushrooms, 1 tablespoon oil, 1/2 teaspoon salt, sesame oil, and black pepper in a bowl.
Wet the edge of a wonton wrapper with water and place 1 tablespoon egg mixture in the center.
Fold wonton wrapper in half and pleat the edges with your fingers. Repeat with remaining wrappers and egg mixture.
Heat 1 tablespoon oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat; add half of the dumplings and fry for 2 minutes.
Pour in boiling water, cover, and cook until bottoms of dumplings are golden brown, about 10 minutes.
Remove and keep warm. Repeat with remaining dumplings.

name: One-Pot Shrimp Scampi Orzo
instructions: Combine olive oil, lemon juice and dried parsley in a small bowl. Add shrimp and toss to coat. Marinate for 15 to 20 minutes.
Melt ghee in a pot over medium-high heat. Add olive oil. Stir in orzo and onion, toss to coat, and cook, 4 to 5 minutes.
Mix in garlic and cook until fragrant, about 30 seconds.
Pour in chicken broth and season with salt and pepper. Cook, stirring frequently, until orzo is tender yet firm to the bite, 8 to 10 minutes.
Add shrimp with marinade to the pot, cover, and cook, stirring occasionally, until shrimp are light pink, 3 to 4 minutes.
Divide between 2 dishes and garnish with lemon slices.

name: Panzanella Salad With Bread Crumbs
instructions: Preheat oven to 300°F.
Bake bread cubes for 15 minutes.
Combine the olive oil, vinegar, salt, and pepper in a jam jar. Shake vigorously. Alternatively, combine ingredients in a small bowl and whisk to combine.
Combine the bread and chopped vegetables in a large mixing bowl. Pour the vinaigrette over top and use a spatula to thoroughly combine.
Garnish with arugula and serve.

name: One Pot Lemon Garlic Butter Shrimp
instructions: In large pan, heat olive oil on medium high until shimmery.
Add shrimp to pan.
Season with salt if desired, and toss shrimp to prevent sticking.
Add garlic and butter and stir.
When garlic is soft and fragrant, about 3 minutes with occasional stirring to prevent burning, add lemons and chili paste and stir to mix.
Toss to coat shrimp evenly with chili and butter sauce.
When shrimp is just opaque and no longer grey, it is cooked. Be careful not to overcook!
Remove from heat and serve immediately.

name: Orange Chicken With Rice
instructions: In a medium skillet bring salted water to a boil. Add rice and cook according to package directions, for 10 minutes. Fluff with a fork and set aside.
In a medium pot, add orange juice, vinegar, soy sauce, ginger, garlic, and red chili flakes. Heat for 3 minutes.
In a small bowl whisk together 1 tbsp cornstarch with 2 tbsp of water and form a paste.
Add to orange sauce and whisk together. Continue to cook for 5 minutes. Add orange zest.
Dip chicken pieces in egg mixture and then flour mixture. Place on plate.
Cook several chicken pieces at a time for 3 minutes and place on a paper towl.
Toss chicken with orange sauce and serve with rice.

name: Paleo Pumpkin Chili
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Heat a large soup pot over medium-high heat and add oil. Once oil is heated through, add ground meat. Cook for 3 minutes. Drain excess fat and set aside.
Add, onion, garlic and bell peppers to the pot. Cook, stirring occasionally, until they are all tender, about 4 minutes. Stir in tomatoes, cacao powder and spices.
Stir in broth, scraping any browned bits from the bottom of the pot. Stir in pumpkin and ground meat and season with salt and pepper, to taste.
Cook over medium low heat for 25 minutes, stirring occasionally. Serve immediately.

name: Oat Apricot Banana Balls
instructions: In a food processor, add the oats, and pulse for 20 seconds in order to break the oats down slightly.
Add the rest of the ingredients and pulse until fully combined.
Roll into 12 balls and refrigerate, then serve.

name: One-Pan Creamy Chicken & Gnocchi
ingredientLines: Freshly ground black pepper, to taste
instructions: Season chicken on both sides with salt and pepper. In a large skillet over medium-high heat, heat 1 tbsp oil.
Add chicken and cook until golden, 4 minutes per side. Remove from skillet. Reduce heat to medium and add remaining oil.
Add shallot and mushrooms and cook until golden, 5 minutes. Add garlic, thyme, and oregano and cook until fragrant, 1 minute more.
Add broth, then slowly add in half and half. Bring to a simmer and add salt, pepper, and pepper flakes. Stir in gnocchi and return chicken to pan.
Let simmer for 10 minutes. Remove chicken from skillet. Add cheeses and stir until melted, then add spinach and stir until wilted.
Slice chicken and return to skillet. Season with more salt and pepper to taste. Serve imemdiately.

name: Parmesan Creamed Corn
instructions: Cook corn according to the package directions and set aside.
Melt butter in a medium saucepan over medium heat. Whisk in flour. Cook until bubbly, about 1 minute.
Gradually whisk in the cream and milk. Cook, stirring constantly, until the sauce thickens. Turn heat to low and add salt, and pepper. Stir in cooked corn.
Pour the corn mixture into a small greased casserole and top with hParmesan. Broil until bubbly.

name: Paleo Stuffed Cabbage
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Combine tomatoes, chicken broth, 1 clove garlic, and 1 teaspoon parsley in a saucepan, bring to a boil.
Add tomato paste. Fill the can 1/4 of the way with hot water; swirl to dissolve any tomato paste remaining in the can and pour into the saucepan.
Season sauce with 1 teaspoon salt and 1/2 teaspoon pepper. Simmer until flavors combine, about 30 minutes.
Mix beef, pork, onion, 3 cloves garlic, basil, oregano, 1/2 teaspoon parsley, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and 1/4 teaspoon pepper together in a large bowl.
Bring a large pot of water to a boil; add 2 tablespoons sea salt. Add cauliflower; cook for 5 minutes. Transfer to a bowl using a slotted spoon.
Add 1 head of cabbage to the boiling water; cook for 5 minutes. Remove with the slotted spoon. Repeat with second cabbage. Separate cabbage leaves.
Shred cauliflower and zucchini in a food processor fitted with the shredder disk.
Add enough to the beef mixture so there is an equal ratio of both. Stir in eggs and almond flour.
Lay 1 cabbage leaf on a flat surface. Roll 1 tablespoon of the beef mixture into a log and place in the middle of the leaf.
Overlap with the bottom of the leaf; fold in opposing edges and roll up. Repeat with remaining leaves and beef mixture.
Coat the bottom of a large baking dish with a layer of tomato sauce. Arrange cabbage rolls seam-side down in the dish.
Cover with remaining tomato sauce. Cover dish with aluminum foil. Bake in the preheated oven until sauce is bubbling, about 1 hour.

name: One Pan Orecchiette Pasta
instructions: Heat olive oil in a large, deep skillet over medium heat.
Add onion with a pinch of salt; cook and stir until onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir in sausage and cook until browned, 5 to 7 minutes.
Pour 1 1/2 cups chicken broth into sausage mixture and bring to a boil while scraping the browned bits of food off of the bottom of the pan with a wooden spoon.
Add orecchiette pasta, cook and stir pasta in hot broth, adding remaining broth when liquid is absorbed, about 15 minutes.
Stir arugula into sausage-pasta mixture until arugula wilts. Ladle pasta into bowls and sprinkle with Parmigiano-Reggiano cheese.

name: Paleo Cauliflower Rice
instructions: Place cauliflower chunks in a food processor and pulse until broken down into rice-size pieces.
Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat, add cauliflower 'rice', cumin, salt, and pepper.
Cover skillet and cook until heated through, 3 to 5 minutes. Remove lid and fluff 'rice' with a fork.

name: Paleo Spaghetti Carbonara
instructions: Preheat oven to 400°F.. Place squash, cut side up, on a baking sheet.
Bake squash in the preheated oven until tender, 45 minutes to 1 hour. Scoop out flesh and shred squash into strands using a fork.
Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat, cook and stir bacon in the hot oil until browned and cooked through, 5 to 10 minutes.
Add shredded squash; cook and stir until squash is softened, 3 to 5 minutes.
Stir salt, and pepper into squash mixture, remove skillet from heat.
Stir egg yolks into squash mixture, without letting the egg yolks touch the skillet, until mixture is creamy.
Transfer squash carbonara to a serving bowl, garnish with basil sprigs.

name: Oven Fried Zucchini Sticks
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F. Spread olive oil on a large baking sheet.
Mix water and flour together in a bowl to form a thick, pancake-like batter.
Stir bread crumbs, herbes de Provence, garlic powder, salt, pepper, and cayenne pepper together on a shallow plate.
Dip zucchini spears into the batter. Roll in bread crumb mixture to coat.
Place spears cut-side down on the prepared baking sheet, all facing the same direction.
Bake in the preheated oven until lightly golden, about 10 minutes. Turn to other cut side and bake for 10 minutes.
Turn spears so they are skin-side down, continue baking until browned, about 5 minutes more.
Transfer zucchini spears to a platter. Serve with vegan mayonnaise and ketchup.

name: Paleo Taro Chips
ingredientLines: 1 taro, peeled and sliced into sticks
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F.
Place taro in a 1- to 2-inch deep dish. Brush evenly with olive oil and sprinkle with salt
Bake in the preheated oven until tops of chips are crisp, about 15 minutes, flip chips and continue baking until second side is crisp, about 15 more minutes.

name: Paleo Hash
instructions: Heat olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir chicken sausage and chorizo sausage in the hot oil, about 10 minutes. Drain excess grease.
Stir sweet potato, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and pepper into sausage mixture, add chicken broth and simmer, 10 to 15 minutes.
Mix zucchini into sweet potato-sausage mixture and simmer until zucchini is tender, 5 to 10 minutes. Drain excess liquid.
Fill a large saucepan with 2 to 3 inches of water and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to medium-low and keep the water at a gentle simmer.
Crack an egg into a small bowl then gently slip the egg into the simmering water, holding the bowl just above the surface of the water.
Poach the egg until the whites are firm and the yolks have thickened but are not hard, 2 1/2 to 3 minutes.
Remove egg from the water with a slotted spoon. Repeat with the other eggs.
Top sweet potato-sausage mixture with poached egg.

name: Paleo Sweet Potato Soup
instructions: Place potatoes, cut sides down, in an 11 x 7-inch microwave-safe baking dish. Add water and cover with plastic wrap. Microwave on high for 15 minutes.
Heat a saucepan over medium-high heat. Add oil, swirl to coat. Add onion, saute 1 minute or until translucent. Stir in cumin and red pepper.
Add stock to pan and bring to a boil. Place sweet potato and stock mixture in a blender and puree until smooth. Pour pureed soup into a large bowl. Stir in salt.
Divide among bowls and serve, topped with parsley.

name: Paleo Taco Salad
instructions: Mix together chili powder, cumin, garlic powder, cayenne pepper, salt, and ground black pepper in a small bowl.
Heat a large skillet over medium-high heat and cook ground beef, stirring often, until the meat is crumbly, about 10 minutes.
Mix in onion and garlic, cook and stir until the onion has softened and turned translucent, about 5 minutes.
Stir spice mixture into ground beef mixture and cook until fragrant, 2 to 3 more minutes.
Combine salsa and lime juice in a small bowl.
To serve, spread shredded romaine lettuce onto a serving platter and top with meat mixture, salsa mixture, cherry tomatoes, Cheddar cheese, and chopped cilantro.

name: Parsley-Avocado Smoothie With Lemon
ingredientLines: 2 tbsp unflavored pea protein powder (or other)
instructions: Add all ingredients to a blender and blend on high until everything is smooth. Serve immediately.

name: Parmesan With Fennel
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F and lightly grease a medium baking dish.
Clean the fennel by cutting off the stalks, then cut the bulb in half lengthwise.  Remove the hard core in the middle,  then cut thin slices.
In a small bowl mix together the parmesan, bread crumbs, salt, pepper and oregano.
Line the slices in the prepared baking pan and sprinkle with the parmesan mixture.
Drizzle with olive oil and bake for approximately 20 minutes.

name: Paleo Orange Chicken
ingredientLines: 1 lb chicken breasts, cut into bit-sized pieces
instructions:
Season the chicken with sea salt and black pepper.
In a large skillet, heat the oil over medium-high heat.
Dip the chicken pieces in the egg, shake off the excess.
Working in batches, place a single layer of chicken into the pan. Cook for a few minutes on each side.
Remove the chicken from the pan and cover with foil to keep warm.
In the same skillet, heat the oil over medium heat. Add the garlic and saute for about 1 minute, until fragrant.
Add the coconut aminos, sesame seeds, wine vinegar, orange zest, and ground ginger.
Bring the sauce to a gentle boil, reduce the heat, and simmer for 10 minutes, until the volume is reduced, and the sauce thickens and looks glossy.
Return the chicken to the pan and toss to coat. The sauce will thicken as it cools from hot to warm. Garnish with parsley.

name: Paleo Slow Cooker Teriyaki Chicken
instructions: Place chicken thighs in a 4-quart slow cooker.
Mix coconut aminos, dry sherry, water, rice wine vinegar, sesame oil, ginger, and garlic together in a small bowl. Pour over chicken.
Cook chicken on High until tender, 2 1/2 to 3 hours.
Transfer chicken to a serving dish, reserving cooking liquid in the slow cooker.
Serve chicken with a garnish of sesame seeds.

name: Paleo Friendly Banana Shake
instructions: Puree bananas and vanilla extract in a blender until smooth. Add coconut milk gradually until desired consistency is reached.

name: Paleo Shepherd'S Pie
instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F.
Melt 1 tablespoon coconut oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add carrots and onion, season with salt and pepper.
Cook and stir until onion is translucent and carrots begin to soften, about 5 minutes.
Stir peas, garlic, curry powder, garlic powder, turmeric, paprika, oregano, and cumin into the pot, cook until combined, about 2 minutes.
Add extra coconut oil as needed. Stir in ground beef, cook until browned, about 5 minutes. Add tomato paste and stir until fully incorporated, about 2 minutes.
Place a steamer insert into a saucepan and fill with water to just below the bottom of the steamer. Bring water to a boil.
Add cauliflower, cover, and steam until tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and pat dry with paper towels.
Combine drained cauliflower, ghee, and cream cheese in a large bowl. Mash with an immersion blender until smooth.
Spread beef mixture evenly in a large casserole dish. Cover with mashed cauliflower. Brush beaten egg lightly on top.
Bake in the preheated oven until hot, about 10 minutes. Turn on oven broiler, cook until top is browned in places, about 5 minutes.

name: Paleo Kale Chips
instructions: Preheat oven to 450°F. Oil a baking sheet with olive oil.
Put kale in a bowl and add coconut oil, mix with your hands until evenly coated.
Spread coated kale onto the prepared baking sheet. Sprinkle garlic salt, salt, and pepper over kale.
Place baking sheet in the oven and turn off oven. Leave kale in the oven until crisp, about 20 minutes.
